wikipedia_page.main:
Ernest George Read (8 October 1873 – 21 March 1921) was an English first-class cricketer. Read was a right-handed batsman who played primarily as a wicketkeeper.
Read made his first-class debut for Hampshire in the 1903 County Championship against Kent. Read played three matches for Hampshire, all coming in the 1903 season with his final match for the county coming against Sussex.
In 1904 Read joined Sussex, making his debut for the county against Cambridge University. Read played two first-class matches for Sussex in the 1904 season, the second of which came against Oxford University.
Two years after last representing Sussex, Read played two matches for the county in 1906 against Oxford University and Middlesex.
Read died at Wandsworth, London on 21 March 1921.

response: The cricketer Ernest Read was his nephew.  Six months after having his left leg amputated, Bencraft died at Compton and Shawford, near Winchester, aged 85.

Ernest Read (22 February 1879 – 9 October 1965) was an English conductor, organist, and music educator. He had a profound impact on the development of music education within England during the first half of the 20th century, and published several books on music pedagogy. He was named a Commander of the Order of the British Empire in 1956.

In 1931 Read founded the Ernest Read Symphony Orchestra (ERSO),UK Amateur Orchestras: London (inside the M25) amateurorchestras.org.uk, including contact listing for ERSO, accessed 2 July 2018 a professional orchestra with a commitment to performing concerts accessible to children as well as adults. He conducted the orchestra up until his death 34 years later, taking it to concerts in schools, concert halls and for the BBC.

For some years (running until the late 1990s) the related organisation ERMA (Ernest Read Music Association) ran summer schoolsObituary for Emanuel Hurwitz: mentions his tutoring at ERMA Summer Schools Independent.co.uk, accessed 2 July 2018 for talented musical students and keen adult amateur musicians. These primarily featured orchestras playing the large-scale symphonic orchestral repertoire, but also with associated choral, conducting,Yan Yin Wing biography bhso.org, accessed 2 July 2018] percussion and listeners' courses. These took place initially at Queenswood School, Herts, then ran for a while at Roedean School,Richard Armitage biography page at Ipswich Orchestral Society iosoc.org, accessed 2 July 2018 and latterly at St Mary's School, Wantage.

Read was a keen exponent of Dalcroze Eurhythmics, a holistic approach to music through bodily movement, developed by Swiss musician Émile Jaques-Dalcroze. In 1945 he established the lauded Ernest Read Concerts for Children, which ran until the late 1990s. ERSO remain active today (2015).facebook - ERSO including concert listings facebook.com, accessed 2 July 2018 Read died, aged 86, in London.
*Ernest Read, cricketer, was born in Portsmouth
